Articles.Content:
I think that we need somewhere where all of the kerbals hard work pays off. I think a Museum would be a great addition to the kerbal space center. Here you can find all the kerbals accomplishments. When ever you plant a new flag a kerbal would be carrying a camera that they carry so when you take a picture that picture would be sent to the Museum and you could write out the explanation of what happened that day, and if you don't like a picture you could send it to the "Top Secret" folder where you can decide to delete it or keep it there. The museum could also come in handy with money. The more objects in the museum the more tourists and that means more money! This could also hold another Celestial Bodies dirt or rock that you would bring back and put in the museum. The most uncommon things benefit you by having more tourists, increasing you money! The camera can be used anywhere, such as space walks, inside the capsules, planets, moons,etc. But (This will be tailored by another suggestion) if you were to send monkeys into space or whatever creature equivalent to monkeys up there, they can't use cameras. This will bring a bigger use of kerbals instead of using computer based rockets. There would also be a camera part for rovers. Such as the Curiosity rover. As well as a scoop thingy to scan rocks, BUT you can't bring rocks back! This would bring a greater use to kerbals.

Tell me your take on the suggestion!
